p: The primary natural host of IAVs are wild aquatic birds (mainly of the order Anseriformes) [ 4, 5] with the exception of H17N10 and H18N11 which have exclusively been isolated from bats [ 6]. AIVs may also cause sporadic incursions in domestic poultry; evidenced by H7N1 outbreaks in Italy from 1990 to 2000, and additionally in humans and other mammalian species [ 7, 8, 9].
